website_summaries.verdict: This handcrafted guitar is challenging to keep in tune, but its nylon strings won't hurt little fingers.
pros: At 30" long, it's meant for kids ages 4 through 9
Comes with nylon strings and songbook
Handcrafted wood body is solid and hard to damage

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to the detractors
customer_reviews.text: Despite it's low price, this is not a toy but a musical instrument. Many here complain about tuning that doesn't hold. The guitar ships with cheap strings meant for normal scale guitars that are not properly secured on the guitar's bridge and the tuning pegs so they lose tension, and tuning, very quickly. You'll need to order special 1/2 guitar strings ( and secure them properly to the bridge and wind them properly on the tuning pegs. Once you do that, this guitar will sing. We love this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Nimrod S. Erez

customer_reviews.title: ... grandson this 1/2 size guitar and the quality is excellent. He just loves it
customer_reviews.text: We gave our grandson this 1/2 size guitar and the quality is excellent. He just loves it.
customer_reviews.author: gail weber

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the quality for price
customer_reviews.text: I've played guitar for 20 years so I was pretty hesitant to buy a learner guitar for my son off of amazon. It took about a week to get the top E string to hold tune, but it's been consistent since then and he's learning to play, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Strong

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the value
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is great for its value. It does work and can be a toy guitar for children. However the frets are really small for me to bar chord. It does not seem to hold tune until after a week of rapid tuning. Be patient. The Prime Delivery for me was delayed twice by a total of 3 days for no reason. I was not quite happy but the quality and value of this guitar act as a pacifier to my complaining mind. My 1year old and I absolutely love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: B.C.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It broke after two days... It came unglued at the headstock when the strings were tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Bach

customer_reviews.title: Solid Kids Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little guitar for the price. It was a gift for my son’s 3 year birthday. Of course, he doesn’t know how to play but it’s something he can strum around on while I’m playing mine. It tunes well and plays well for a half size guitar. Seems to hold its tuning ok but I can’t really tell since my kid plays with the strings pretty hard. I bought this because it looked to the better of the kids guitars and isn’t plastic or easily breakable. He has sat on it without it breaking so I can that it’s quite durable!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Its ok doesn't hold tuning.
customer_reviews.text: Its ok .It needs to be restrung string suck and it doesn't keep in tune for long you will need to tune it every time. Ok for a 6 year old but not if they really want to learn.I will have to buy a better one next year.I would appreciate a partial refund not worth the $50 more like $30 would be a fair price for this.
customer_reviews.author: JOE GAVIDIA

customer_reviews.title: Great little guitar for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I read the reviews on this great little guitar. Soon as I got it, i re-strung it with a new set of 1/2 size guitar strings as per reviews. That made a big difference in sound quality and ease of tuning. This is for our grandkids when they visit. To make sure it stayed in tune, I have been playing it to streach the strings. What a fun mini guitar! I known my grandkids will like it too. Ages are 3, 6, 8, & 9.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Wenninger

customer_reviews.title: This is a good guitar for starting to learn how to play
customer_reviews.text: This is a good guitar for starting to learn how to play, especially if you're not sure if your kid is going to stick to his/her lessons. Our 7 years old enjoys it and it is a good size for him. He has been using it for almost a year now (it was a birthday present) and it still holds well. I did get a guitar case for it. It helps with the bumpy carrying...
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: Fun, nice looking, but strings aren't the best.
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels great. The sound is OK. The low E and A strings, especially the E, are oversized for the guitar and so are very loose when tuned properly. I'm not sure what strings I should use on this since it's probably not meant for full-size strings. Unless i can figure out what to do about those low strings, I'd say this is great for a toy to get a kid familiarized with the instrument and have fun with, but it may not be the best instrument to actually learn on.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Mo

customer_reviews.title: Cannot tune without snapping strings
customer_reviews.text: I am an experience guitarist. Bought this for my daughter / beginner. The tune would not hold for more than 30 seconds... each string would drop a full note. The E string actually snapped on me when tuning and sliced my hand. I put a capo on the remaining strings and the D string randomly snapped while a few minutes after putting the capo on. I will re-string it and update review.. but really, I shouldn't have to restring it. Waste of time an energy. Also, be careful when trying to tune this thing. Almost ended up with stitches... HAZARD.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product but.....
customer_reviews.text: Nice Product but..... you can feel quality is not very high. The guitar is for my 5 year son so it is perfect for him as a beginner but as soon as he will be advancing on the guitar lessons we will need to change it.
customer_reviews.author: Arnau

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a young grandson, expecting it to be poor quality. But it really is a nice little beginner guitar for a child. Adults or those with good guitars would be disappointed with it. But it is not toy-quality. Much better than that. I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: lhj313

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: I own a music school. I bought a couple of these for young children. However, one of the guitar instructors pointed out the extra fret at the nut, which makes the instrument play very sharp. The tuning pegs are difficult to adjust. I won't purchase this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Arhelger

customer_reviews.title: 5 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: OMG this was ladt minute purchase for Christmas. Well it was the favorite gift for my 5 year old granddaughter. She strums it every single day, and does little skits like she is on Americas got talent, it is so nice to see her having so much fun with something that encourages imagination..
customer_reviews.author: angelxccc

customer_reviews.title: Great for introducing the the guitar to young children!
customer_reviews.text: I’m an accomplished guitarist of 20+ years and I bought this guitar to introduce my 2-year-old son to the instrument, and it’s perfect for exactly that. It is a great size for him, and while it certainly is a “toy”, it actually holds a decent tune, and is nice to play. I’ve had fun playing around on it myself! For the price, I don’t know if you could get a better instrument. Definitely recommend for a young kid’s first guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: The neck broke on day 1
customer_reviews.text: With normal use, the neck cracked on our guitar on day 1 of its use. I tuned it correctly and have owned at least one guitar for most of my life. I suspect there is a weakness of the wood in the neck. I give this guitar just one star because I've called and written the manufacturer many times and they have not responded to discuss the warranty. So disappointing to me and my children.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Naugle

customer_reviews.title: Great size, and quality is actually very nice for ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our 5 year old grandson. He was thrilled! Great size, and quality is actually very nice for a guitar made for children!
customer_reviews.author: Denice B.

customer_reviews.title: Great learner guitar!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a cheap guitar like the ones I purchased in Mexico. This is better, it is a half sized classical guitar. It stays in tune much better than the cheaper ones. And when I say "cheaper" I do not mean pay less. I got this one on sale on Amazon for $35. My son plays guitar with me and it makes my heart sing more than the guitar. WORTH the money just for this! I saw the negative review with the You Tube video. I am not having this problem. I love this guitar. It is a real guitar! Give this to your kid to play with and he will get used to pressing the strings!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great small guitar for beginners and children
customer_reviews.text: My son (2 yrs old) loves playing instruments and had a small used guitar like this that he got from my parent that he eventually broke. We wanted to get him a new one, but nothing too expensive, since he isn't the most careful with his stuff. This small guitar is perfect. We love the size, design, and the fact that there is half steel and half nylon strings. We have had it for a month and it has kept tune really well. NOTE: at first the tune will not hold because the nylon strings stretch, but after tightening them a few time and they were tight, it held really well.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina P.

customer_reviews.title: This guitar can NOT be tuned. If tightened any ...
customer_reviews.text: This guitar can NOT be tuned. If tightened any more, the string will break. Can you send me one that is already tuned? Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Lehn

customer_reviews.title: Hohner!  Very Good For 50 USD!
customer_reviews.text: I have twin boys, and they usually destroy most toys in the span of a few days. I fully expect these guitars to last long enough that when my boys move up to bigger instruments I can sore them away fully functional. Built well, no neck joint issues, machine heads are metal, and all glued joints are holding true - a great deal for 50 bucks each. Also, between the two guitars there are no differences in build. I'm a musician and have played guitar and bass for over 35 years. If you are looking for a first guitar for your twin five year old boys, these are the guitars for you. ;) ...and they hold a tuning. :)
customer_reviews.author: ubercat

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 1st time leaner
customer_reviews.text: Great for the deal and whats expected from it. As a first learner guitar it is perfect. Guitar teacher says its Made well and works well. Maybe not for long time use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: We had it for a 1/2 day before returning to Amazon. Yes, it's a $50 guitar so our expectations were low. However, two of the machine heads (tuners) were extremely difficult to turn. Our last straw was the E string not staying in tune as a result of the tuner not functioning properly (no, it wasn't simply string stretch). Spend $20-30 more and you'll get a better quality intro instrument for your kid(s).
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT Buy, should have listened to others!
customer_reviews.text: Should have listed to other reviewers. The guitar keeps detuning, the sound is absolutely horrible. Can't even train my little one to play on it due to the quality of the product!
customer_reviews.author: sach

customer_reviews.title: It's a REAL guitar
customer_reviews.text: Super please with the product. I originally ordered a similar looking one made by First Act and it broke as we took it out of the box. Went back and hoping if I spent a little more money I'd get a much better product and that is exactly what happened. This is made of wood .... not cheap plastic. The strings are attached well and it sounds amazing. Perfect size for kids ages 5-10
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: ... this for my child to learn on but it's useless. I mean it's good to get this fingers ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my child to learn on but it's useless. I mean it's good to get this fingers in practice but it doesn't stay in tune worth a flip.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew M. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: ... the low price this small nylon string guitar is great! Even though this size is probably used overwhelming ...
customer_reviews.text: For the low price this small nylon string guitar is great! Even though this size is probably used overwhelming by children, this is my fourth 1/2 size guitar and I have been playing for over 40 years! Compared to my other small guitars this one: has the lowest price, is made well and holds a tune as well or better than the others. My best 1/2 size guitar is the Yamaha small guitar-uke, which is constructed better but is almost 3 times more money and slightly worse tone. This is an ideal first guitar for small hands, but I like it too.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Its the perfect size for a behaved toddler thru preteen
customer_reviews.text: Its exactly what we were hoping for. Its a very real guitar, not a toy, my grandson loves sitting next to his daddy, my son who plays and my grandson is actually learning. Its the perfect size for a behaved toddler thru preteen.
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: It's alright but....................
customer_reviews.text: I don't see how anyone could give this even three stars let alone four or five. At first it didn't hold tune at all but is getting better after three days. Basically this is somewhere between a toy and a guitar but I guess it will do for my two year old granddaughter who basically right now is just strumming with a pick and exploring. I was hoping it would be good enough for two or three years and it might be unless she really gets going....... Not saying not to buy it but don't expect a lot good thing I bought the snark tuner because it needs to be tuned every five minutes.
customer_reviews.author: John Maniz

customer_reviews.title: nice product for kids / beginners.
customer_reviews.text: nice product. works for kids. i am not a guitar player myself, but got this for my kiddo. his teacher said that this was good enough for beginners. when i read the other reviews, i did not know why this is good for "beginners".. but after hearing the teacher play his professional guitar while teaching, i understood the difference.
customer_reviews.author: NPK

customer_reviews.title: A real guitar
customer_reviews.text: Great little guitar I got for my 5 yr old. I play it more than him and it holds tuning well. Only thing is low action makes rattle on A string if played hard. Can be remedied as stars by other reviewer.
customer_reviews.author: Kendrick W

customer_reviews.title: I read all the reviews, reseearched every 1/2 size ...
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews, reseearched every 1/2 size guitar suitable for a beginner that would stay tuned...this one won't evn let me tune it and I also bought a tuner!!!...I am so frustrated with it, I am going to try to tighten the nuts a bit if my allen wrench will fit the sockets, and I know nylon strings stretch and stretch and that new strings take time to break in and get stretched enough to stay tuned...but right now I am dismayed!!
customer_reviews.author: am

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and size
customer_reviews.text: Great first guitar for my almost 5 year old son. It is made very well and great quality. The sound is right on, others mentioned that it does not hold a tune, that is because 3 of the strings are nylon which means they stretch a lot, once broken in tuning will be a non issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for the price. My only negative comment is it comes out of tune very easily, primarily the upper E string. If I sit down and play on it for a bit I eventually will have to re-tune the upper E string and sometimes some of the others. I would've thought they would make the tuners tighter so they wouldn't unwind so easily, especially since this guitar is made for toddlers who will play it much harder than a grown up. Other than that, my 3 year old daughter does like the guitar and it's nice having a small guitar she can play around with.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for my 6 year old to learn on
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my 6 year old to learn on. I’m the lead singer in a band and have played guitar my whole lift. These nylon strings are the way to go for beginners! I may pick up the 1-2 size strings at some point but it’s no trouble to tune up each day before playing
customer_reviews.author: Luke Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues right out of the box....
customer_reviews.text: This guitar was unusable right out of the box. The 3rd (G) string buzzes so badly against the frets the guitar has to be returned. Ive played guitar for many years and know how to tune one. There's no way to fix it without making major adjustments to the instrument. Not sure how this guitar went out the factory with this issue. This guitar is also very small. Make sure you know the dimensions beforehand. More suited for 5 and under in my opinion. Older than that I'd start looking at a 3/4 scale guitars.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely adorable
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like my husband’s acoustic. Our son was so excited to “play guitar with daddy”. Now he plays and sings songs at bed time

customer_reviews.title: My son's gonna be a rock star!
customer_reviews.text: Guitar arrived quickly and in good shape. It plays well, although strings are a little too close together for my fat adult fingers. The strings were (appropriately) loose in shipping but poor quality and (D string) broke when tuned. The replacement strings that came with it seem ok. It holds a tune after the strings have a chance to stretch and sounds so much better than the cheap plastic toy guitar which it replaced. The neck and fretboard are spaced well for a child, and it seems like a durable well built instrument.
customer_reviews.author: firefly

customer_reviews.title: For the little ones
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for our younger 2 children. 1 wants to learn and the other wants to make noise. The price was good and the size is perfect for the smaller arms. The sound is just as good as a full size and it stays in tune very well.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Walton

customer_reviews.title: The quality is much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grand daughter for Christmas. The quality is much better than I expected. This is not a toy, but a small version of a full sized guitar with similar sound quality. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: best guitar for kids
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is awesome. I have a two year old son who loves to play the guitar, so much that he would play with bruised fingers. I found this guitar because it had nylon strings so they are easier on his fingers. Most little kid guitars look toy like and have cartoon characters on them, this one looks like a real grown up guitar which I love. We have had it now for a couple months and no show of wear and tear. If anything does happen to this one I will buy this same one for him.
customer_reviews.author: SL4

customer_reviews.title: Low quality product
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the quality. 1) only 1 pin to hold a strap, the other is missing. 2) 2 strings cannot be tuned properly because the mechanism is week and does not hold the pressure from strings.
customer_reviews.author: Afonso Novais

customer_reviews.title: and it does sound pretty good - when in tune
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my young children to play with so they would stop trying to play daddy's guitar all the time. The construction and finish of the guitar is above average, and it does sound pretty good - when in tune. It simply won't stay in tune. I have tuned it to standard tuning and open tunings, and it will not hold tune for longer than a few minutes. I thought maybe the strings would stretch and break in, but no. Won't stay in tune.
customer_reviews.author: James Tyler Dancy

customer_reviews.title: My daughter's dream come true!
customer_reviews.text: VERY happy with this purchase. My 7 year old wanted a guitar in the WORST way for Christmas. This is PERFECT for her without being a huge financial risk. The sound is really good, especially given the price. I think I paid like $36. I was able to pick out a few tunes despite never having held a guitar before. The size is good for a tall 7 year old, I would say up to maybe a 10 year old could/should play this size before going to the next larger option.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Kate

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I could not even tune this guitar satisfactorily. One string would not get in tune. Additionally, once tuned it does not even stay in tune for 3 minutes. I bought it for my 5 year old grandson and thought it would be good enough. It is not fun to play a guitar that sounds terrible. Pay a little more and enjoy playing your guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great for little hands
customer_reviews.text: Great for little beginners, my grandson loves this and can handle the size. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Stout

customer_reviews.title: but it does not sound exactly like a real guitar
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 year old to get him used to using an instrument. In my opinion it is between a toy and a real guitar. It's real enough to be taken seriously by our son, but it does not sound exactly like a real guitar, I think because of the strings. That said, he has no trouble holding the strings down, and it is easy to tune. We are happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my 7 yo
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my 7 yo, her fingers are a bit of a stretch but that was expected The 101 info it came with was confusing for us as beginners and endes of on utube
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei S Pender

customer_reviews.title: The sound and quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound, good quality, well made and worth the money. The little guy loved it. He's 4 but it's great for all young children's age 4 and up.
customer_reviews.author: JSW

customer_reviews.title: The perfect starter guitar for a young child.
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is 1/2 sized, so a perfect starter size for little fingers and early learners. It looks and feels exactly like a full sized guitar. The tone isn't full bodied, but very close to what you'd expect out of a classic wooden guitar. The starter strings are nylon. After you tune them a few times to get them stretched out fully they stay tuned and in place.
customer_reviews.author: NanaB

customer_reviews.title: Good instument for the price
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is great for a child. It is not as nice looking as the picture, but it is a miniature classical guitar and does have a decent sound. Even though it's not as beautiful as the picture, it is still an excellent deal for an actual guitar.- Some of the other guitars you may purchase for a child are not very good quality and some you can't even tune. If you want an in-expensive guitar for your little one to learn to play on, this is a good choice. Keep in mind that it is a classical guitar, so the neck is a little wider, but it's still ok size for a child.
customer_reviews.author: S. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect the boys love and play it all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect the boys love and play it all the time. Nice sound, durable, not too rough on their tiny hands.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toddler guitar
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3.5 year old and she loves playing with it. It’s a mini version of dads and that just makes her so happy. It’s really nice quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Deena Bolen

customer_reviews.title: love the sound
customer_reviews.text: For that price, love the sound. however the note and string get off tuned a bit easy. For the toddlerr to start playing, it is not a big deal, but just you want it to be better like a normal guitar. Very good quality finish.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar for a young child.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a 6 year old girl and its the perfect size. Nicely made, good value! Not just a "toy" guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, sturdy, soft strings for beginners. Great size for kiddos
customer_reviews.author: Holly's

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 8 year old daughter!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for my almost 8 year old! She is in love! Packaged so well, and has an absolute gorgeous finish! Would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Rose G

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase that was need
customer_reviews.text: This item was bought to start my grandson on how to play the guitar
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Good starter guitar for kids.
customer_reviews.text: Nice half size guitar. Can hold it's tuning for a while. Easy for small hands. My (small) 6 year old daughter loves to rock out with this guitar. This would be a decent cheap travel guitar. It has a nice warm sound.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Stone

customer_reviews.title: Well made product. Perfect introduction to music
customer_reviews.text: We now own 3 of these guitars. My grand daughters love them and I live seeing them interact with music
customer_reviews.author: Dyce

customer_reviews.title: Fun For Kids!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for my 4 year old. Doesn’t stay tuned but he doesn’t care, he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Freethinker

customer_reviews.title: better ones thinking that would solve the problem
customer_reviews.text: This guitar has something majorly wrong with it. We replaced the strings with brand new, better ones thinking that would solve the problem. Each string is in tune with the rest, but once we strum, the sound is terrible. I wish we could return it, but we spend to much time trying to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Evans

customer_reviews.title: Nice guitar
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific guitar for a young, learning musician. The smaller size is much more manageable for smaller hands and shorter arms. We bought this for a 7-year-old, but I could see her using it for several more years. This does not come with a strap, picks or anything other than a tiny instructional booklet. But the guitar itself impresses.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Hosey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size guitar for my 3 yr old grandson
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size guitar for my 3 yr old grandson. He can manage it, yet it is a little big so he will be using it for a while. He is totally obsessed with it. Came packaged in a nice heavy guitar box and then inside a second box.
customer_reviews.author: suezqm

customer_reviews.title: Good starter guitar
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous when taking my son to his first music lesson because the instructor said that toy guitars bought at Xmas were junk and don't hold a tune. This guitar with the accessories was only $50, so I thought he was going to tell me we'd have to buy a new one. I didn't want to spend a lot of money if my 6 year old didn't like to play. This guitar passed the test: sounds decent and holds a tune.
customer_reviews.author: Hurd Family

customer_reviews.title: Has held up well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for one of our girls to learn on, the little boys have had it in their hands plenty of times. It has held strong!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sears

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the nylon strings because they are hard to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old expressed interest in learning guitar, so we got this for her. She loves it! The book and colored dots that came with it let her use it immediately to play songs. That will keep her going until we get her into lessons. I don't like the nylon strings because they are hard to keep in tune, but we plan to switch strings once she gets the hang of using it.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfThree

customer_reviews.title: Its a pretty decent guitar for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty decent guitar for the price. Looks great, sounds pretty good. My biggest complaint is how hard it is to tune, and that it looses its tuning pretty quickly. My son loves it though!
customer_reviews.author: William Corley

customer_reviews.title: A Guitar like MOM's
customer_reviews.text: Our great granddaughter got this guitar for Christmas. She is only 3 years old and is always wanting to use her Mom's guitar, showing an interest in playing. She loves it and feels important as she has one like her Mom's
customer_reviews.author: Karen C. Klennert

customer_reviews.title: Cute, beginner guitar
customer_reviews.text: Won’t really know until Christmas how well this is received by my grandson who is 4:) he asked for a guitar. He received it and we all had fun singing Christmas carols while he “played”:)
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, works perfectly for our 6 year old girl.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, works perfectly for our 6 year old girl.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio Feito Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Future Rocker
customer_reviews.text: I really liked what I received.Its a purchase for a grandchild who always wants to touch my expensive guitar.He dont understand that I cringe each time he touches it.So 'Paw Paw got him his very own and he loves it.Is it an expensive Martin replica? No and far from it but it holds a tune and more importantly his attention.In a couple of years if he is STILL interested then he will graduate to a better one.Where he is now,perfect!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D.Hill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has been a great guitar for my 6 year old to start lessons with.
customer_reviews.author: KristinS

customer_reviews.title: More than a toy, for a toy budget
customer_reviews.text: As the other reviews mention, these nylon stings will have some play for a while. Overall, it's a great gift for my 4 year old. I play guitar, and have tried to get my spouse interested to no avail. These nylon strings have been easy on both my kid and spouse's hands, getting them interested. This guitar has also taken a beating from my one year old, and has withstood whatever is thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: HMAck

customer_reviews.title: Quality beginners guitar.
customer_reviews.text: This is a musical instrument NOT a toy. My grandson loves it!! Nice sound.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Colwill

customer_reviews.title: Cool but won’t tune
customer_reviews.text: Super cool kids guitar but doesn’t hold a tune. My toddler loves it because it’s just like daddy’s!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Byers

customer_reviews.title: However our kids love playing with it and more importantly are able to ...
customer_reviews.text: First guitar for the kids. Lightweight. Has clear chord distinction. We are not musically inclined. So cant comment on how accurate the sound is. However our kids love playing with it and more importantly are able to handle it and carry the weight appropriately. (7 and 5 year old use it).
customer_reviews.author: Amena S.

customer_reviews.title: I know he is going to love it. very affordable price and just the right ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas gift for my little grandson. I know he is going to love it. very affordable price and just the right size. comes well packaged and ships quickly.
customer_reviews.author: CAROLYN TRIPPLETT

customer_reviews.title: Good size, but can't hold the tune at all
customer_reviews.text: What everyone else said: the size is perfect for an 8 year old, but the guitar can't hold a tune. I'm going to change the strings and see if that makes a difference, but so far - it's pretty unusable...
customer_reviews.author: AnietZ

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive guitar for children, it’s not my ESP but is great for your child that starting or curious about playing. It’s way better than handing them a couple thousand dollar guitar to start on
customer_reviews.author: Paw Paw

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay in tune very long but its easy to tune and perfect for small hands
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality for the price. Doesn't stay in tune very long but its easy to tune and perfect for small hands. It looks like it would break easy if mis-treated but with proper care it will last.
customer_reviews.author: jsky

customer_reviews.title: Wont stay in tune.
customer_reviews.text: The high E string didnt stay in tune. Tried to tune it down a step.. It still doesnt stay in tune. Exchanged for a replacement. replacement had the same issue. Will return that one as well.
customer_reviews.author: OleBear1969

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: There is wood missing/chipped from around the holes/area where the strings are connected at the knobs. The finish has shellac dripping in some areas. I am giving is as a gift for my grandson, so I am a bit embarrassed by it's cheap quality. He is 9 years old and would like to learn to play the guitar. I just hope it isn't so bad that he loses his interest.
customer_reviews.author: M Esselman

customer_reviews.title: Rusty strings
customer_reviews.text: We received our first order of this guitar and one of the strings was rusty from top to bottom. We ordered a replacement and one string is again rusty and buzzing when played. It's very cheaply finished and has one too many fret dividing lines at the very top. We are returning our second one now and trying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Carter

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap backpacking guitar
customer_reviews.text: Actually not bad. Picked it up so I could have something with me in the woods in case I was struck by inspiration there. No buzzing on the frets. It obviously take a number of times tuning it before it will stick, but whatever, that's nothing new. Just tune it A-D-G-C-E-A and it should be set to sound like a normal acoustic in standard tuning. Decent buy for the ridiculously low price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my daughter is dam cute holding this thang. tune doesn't hold that long but what do expect for $40?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The guitar is great and not a toy
customer_reviews.text: The guitar is great and not a toy. The sound is ok with the strings that it comes with, but as someone else said, once replaced the sound will be great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle BD

customer_reviews.title: It's so adorable watching him strum his guitar
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this Christmas present! It's so adorable watching him strum his guitar. My husband is a musician and is a little frustrated with how quickly it gets out of tune be we expect that to slow some as our son learns better technique. For this price I didn't expect much even thought the reviews were favorable. I am so happy we ordered this for our son to get started learning guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Chaney

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product for the price we got it for. My son loved watching his dad play his guitar so I went all in and decided to purchase him one. The guy is still a little big for my son, who is a big three year old, but he still puts forth the effort and loves it. I would recommend purchasing some strings and replacing them but other than that the guitar is great and stayed tuned a lot better than I thought it was gonig to. I would recommend this to a child learnign to play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice for a child but not really for adult. It is too small
customer_reviews.author: Michael Freebird

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old daughter so she would leave my Big Baby alone. It’s a great guitar for the price! New strings require tuning often while they stretch and settle but that’s expected. It’s a legit mini guitar that fits kids well. And will now be my bonfire guitar, ha!
customer_reviews.author: Weston

customer_reviews.title: This is a good quality kids guitar for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Got this guitar for my neice when she was about 5 (3 years ago.) It has lasted amazingly well, is built sturdy and has soft, nylon-type strings, that don't hurt little fingers when making chords. The guitar strings have never broken. In addition to its sturdiness, what I really like about this guitar is that it can be tuned and played like a real adult guitar. My boyfriend has played guitar for 30 years and occasionally tunes this guitar and plays it. The sound is really pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn

customer_reviews.title: It looks and feels like a cheap toy but it works for now for ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks and feels like a cheap toy but it works for now for my daughters first guitar lessons. She's 7 and she's is always the smallest in her class - and this guitar looks almost too small for her but the teacher says it's a good fit. If she does well then I'll get a higher quality guitar that'll last - but for now this cheap little toy will do. It needs to be tuned everyday.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fausto

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our three year old grandson!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality and value. Our little guy shows interest in music and is able to easily hold this half size guitar and make some noise. Next we'll look for some basic lessons online. Fun stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hands and fingers
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 year old and it does the job quite nicely. It's light, fits well with his body, and doesn't hurt his fingers like my larger guitars. It does require frequent tuning, but that's no big deal. It's not the most well-made thing in the world, but it does just fine for it's intended use.
customer_reviews.author: RP+BP

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a little kid
customer_reviews.text: This works fine as a toy for a 2-3 yr old and also served as a introduction to a musical instrument for a child. Our litttle guy enjoys performing with it. I would not try to use this to teach a child how to play. It does not hold its tuning for more than a few minutes at best.
customer_reviews.author: Medulla

customer_reviews.title: It's very nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my granddaughter. It's very nice for the money. It actually is playable. It does take a long time for the strings (G, B & E) to say in tune, but then again I normally play steel string guitars. I'm sure eventually they'll settle in.
customer_reviews.author: MPH

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Being a guitar player myself i wanted a real guitar and not a toy for my 6 year old daughter. I am very happy with the purchase. I bought new strings right away but have not had to change them since the once it came with are really good. Even holds the tune pretty descently.
customer_reviews.author: magnus

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly sized and priced for a youngster showing interest in learning to play. Why waste your money on something more expensive if you dont know theyre even going to stick with it or enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: brian carlson

product_meta.title: Hohner 6 String Acoustic Guitar, Right Handed, Natural (HAG250P)
product_meta.description: Style:Hohner GuitarHohner welcomes you to the world of playing guitar. The Hohner HAG250P is a handcrafted classical guitar with an Agathis top back and sides. This wood match-up creates a crisp texture to the overall sound of the instrument. The smaller scale of this instrument (considered 1/2 sized) is specially designed with the younger player in mind and is highly recommended for the players that are starting between the ages of 5-9. This instrument also comes equipped with light gauge nylon strings for easier fingering as to not discourage the first time player. Hohner has a long tradition of supporting music education. While being in business for over 150 years Hohner has enjoyed creating instruments to help people of all ages express themselves through music. Most recently Hohner has joined forces with GAMA, an organization dedicated to bringing the joy of playing guitar into school systems nationwide. For more information on Hohner and their instruments please visit www.Hohnerusa.com. Customer Care Number 1-800-446-6010

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars737 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
